item.title: Stringing together several free tiers to host an application with zero cost using fly.io, Litestream and Cloudflare
item.description: The image was generated by putting the blog post title into DALL-E 2. Quite fitting! I have a side project called bostadsbussen. It scrapes property listings for the Swedish real estate market. The site needs to persist data in the form of user accounts, property data and images. At the time of writing this post I am currently on a sabbatical. With my income at 0, I want to keep the cost of hosting my side project as low as possible.

item.title: Work apps need work data
item.description: When you use apps for work, they rarely show you all the data that you need to get the full context of your work. And that's a shame because that information is often readily available to you, and could be integrated into your app.

item.title: On Caching Elixir Beam files · Anantha Kumaran
item.description: Nowadays it’s a standard practice to cache dependencies and compiled artifacts to improve CI build time. For Elixir apps, this would mean caching the contents of _build and deps. The compiler is smart enough to figure out what needs to be recompiled. This setup was working well except for one annoying issue.

item.title: Technical Evaluation of a Startup
item.description: In February of 2021 I was asked to do a technical evaluation for a startup. The team had 7-10 engineers but lacked senior technical leadership, and the investment team and CEO wanted to make sure they were on track. I've sent this to a few other fractional CTOs who found it helpful, and maybe you will, too.

item.title: Problem Details responses everywhere with ASP.NET Core and .NET 7
item.description: The Problem Details for HTTP APIs RFC provides a unified, machine-readable and standardized recipe for exposing error information out of your HTTP APIs – which is of course beneficial both for the API authors, as well as the integrating parties.
